And it's very easy to get our eyes shifted from what the biblical principle is and get into the monotony of life, to the monotony, the mundane behavior of I just go to work, I'm just in and out and I'm just doing. No, no, God has you there for a purpose. When I understand this morning that whatsoever I do, I do it heartily as to the Lord, not unto men. I'm seeking to please God. And you know, God can move us wherever he wants to move us and he can give us employment wherever he wants to give us employment and we seek to be, even in that place, his representative. Are there challenges? Absolutely. You know why there are challenges? Because the devil doesn't want you to do it. So there'll be challenges. But the reality is that we can pray to the God of heaven who can move in hearts and lives and can bring to pass amazing things. Listen, you might not be able to talk to your coworker about the Lord in certain settings because of the task at hand and the responsibility of being a good employee, but if you get a lunch break, there's nothing that says that you can't have lunch with someone. And here's the thing, and this is, God's been helping me in this, not only through just a variety of means, talking with some of our missionaries and learning some things about some of what our missionaries are dealing with and some of the difficulties that they have faced and so on and so forth is that, maybe what we do is we just spend consistent time in prayer for an individual before we start trying to beat them over the head with Bible. And just pray that God would soften their heart, that God would allow things in their lives that will help them to understand their need for Christ. Maybe it's your neighbor. or maybe it's a family member that we just pray for. Within the context of this text of scripture, maybe it's a co-worker. When we ended the revival meeting, Pastor Edwards made this statement on one of the nights, I think it was Tuesday evening. He asked this question about God placing someone's name on your heart to pray for. And I just wonder this morning, as you think about your workplace, and you think about the context of this particular message, maybe there's a decision that we need to make that, you know what, I've kind of lost focus a little bit. I've kind of lost my way in the workplace. I've gotten caught up in the politics of work. The office politics and the office whatever. And I've not really been working heartily as to the Lord. I've not really been the employee that I ought to be. You know that, God knows that. But maybe this morning, maybe God would put someone's name on your heart. And you just wanna make a commitment to God, I'm gonna pray for them. And I'm gonna pray that God will open up a door of opportunity. I believe with all of my heart that when we pray that God will open opportunities and we make a commitment that will seize those opportunities, that those are prayers that God delights in answering. Oftentimes it's easy to see an opportunity going then coming. We say, man, I missed that opportunity. But if we're specifically engaged in praying for a coworker and praying that God will open their heart to the truth of the gospel and praying that God would give us the opportunity. I had plenty of times where I had coworkers that would come to me and say, say it in different ways. I know you're a, I had somebody say, I know you're a man of the cloth. And the world is that, man. Anyway, they'd say it different ways. But they'd say, you know what? We just found out somebody's got cancer, somebody's got my this, my that. Would you pray for me? Because God works in the hearts of people. And if you begin to pray for those opportunities and you begin to pray for that one that God will put on your heart and mind, and you faithfully do that, and you're the best worker that you can be because you're serving Christ, God will open up doors of opportunity. And you may be the one that they come to and say, would you pray for me? You can pray for them. You see how that door just got opened for God to work. And of course, the greatest need that anyone needs, the greatest need that any individual has is the need for salvation. Oftentimes, it will be a need for health, it'll be a need for finances, it'll be a need for marriage, it'll be a need for fill in the blank that will bring them to the place of realizing they're falling apart, their life is a mess. And then, ultimately, through conversation and through biblical truth, they'll realize what they really need is Christ. What they need is Christ. And God has you in your place. I would not do it for sake of the fact that we're on live stream, but if I could, if I knew, I don't even know everywhere that people work in our church, but if I knew the name of each employer, in my heart and in my mind, it's we have a missionary to fill in the blank, a missionary to fill in the blank, a missionary to fill in the blank. These are the missionaries from our church that this week, that tomorrow, get to go into all of those workplaces and let your light shine. We tell the kids, we sing it with the kids. This little light of mine, I'm gonna let it shine. Hide it under a bushel. No! But man, we go to the workplace, we say, man, I left that light at home because I am, right? But we're his representatives, we're his ambassadors. And I believe this morning in the culture, in the age in which we're living, that this truth about our behavior in the workplace can be the catalyst to revival in our world because we go all over the place, all of our different respective places of employment, and we can reach people with the gospel. Let's pray. Father, we love you this morning. We thank you for loving us. God, we thank you for your Word and how your Word gives us instruction truly in every area of our lives. This morning, as we focus our attention upon this portion of Scripture and deal with our behavior in the workplace, I thank you for the places of employment that you've given to our church family, the places in which you have chosen to plant them, not solely for the purpose of making a living, for the purpose of being your representative. There are souls that daily come in contact with those that are sitting in this building and those that are listening via live stream that do not know the Lord Jesus Christ. Lord, as we faithfully pray for our missionaries, pray this morning that you would help us to faithfully pray for one another with the thought that we go as missionaries not to a foreign country, but to a company. God, I pray that you'd help us to be the employees that we're to be. Would you help us to operate with integrity, singleness of heart? Would you help us in whatsoever we do to do it heartily as unto the Lord, not unto men? Would you help us, God, to exalt and magnify you in our lives and even in the workplace? Put that name of that coworker on folks' hearts this morning. I pray that we would make a commitment to pray faithfully and diligently that you would open up doors of opportunity, that those opportunities would be seized. Lord, you'd help us to see souls saved and lives changed. But truly, this could be a catalyst for revival. We pray that you'd seal every decision, that you'd work as only you can. We'll thank you for it, in Christ's name we pray. Would you stand?
